description: The underlying cause of the update failure (error code 0x80070643) when applying the January 9, 2024 update (KB-5034441) for Windows 10 versions 21H2 and 22H2 is linked to the absence of a recovery partition on the PC. When the system lacks this partition, the installation process does not have the necessary components to handle the update, resulting in an 'install failure'. Users do not require this particular update if the recovery partition is not present, thus the error can be regarded as a false positive and can be ignored safely. Microsoft acknowledges this issue and is currently working on a resolution to address it in a future release. This scenario emphasizes the importance of ensuring system configurations align with update requirements to avoid unnecessary installation hurdles.
